result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Patrick McDonald was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas Patrick McDonald is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas Patrick McDonald was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Nicholas Patrick McDonald was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to meet with the payment clerk. 
DNA surcharge.

Concurrent to 15CF117.
Court dismisses Counts 1, 4 and 5.
Defendant to report to Probation as soon as he is released from jail.
Bond is modified to Signature and will be vacated as soon as Defendant reports to Probation.

  

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: 15CF117

records.addlTxt: filed by DE requesting to have DL reinstated.     Per RMW on 10/21/19- Vacate Suspension.  Clerk called DE. bph

DE called to inquire about the paperwork he rec'd in the mail re: FTP. DE was advised that he made his Sept pymt late, but is now current & his Pymt Plan has been reinstated just this once. DE was advised that if he were to miss another pymt, he will either be warranted or sent to Collections. DE inquired about getting his license reinstated & was advised he may submit a request in writing. DE stated he will drop his request off tomrw. CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Nicholas Patrick McDonald appeared from jail.  Court called  Set for PTC.  There is an agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rigths Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charges and maximum penalties. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 2.  Guilty plea is entered.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct. 3.  Guilty Plea is entered.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 2 & Ct. 3. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1, Ct. 4 & Ct. 5. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

Ct. 2 in 15CM739
-DE sentenced to 55 days in the St. Croix County Jail with credit for good time
- Credit for 41 days time served
- Court costs of $243.00 and $200.00 for the DNA Surcharge


Ct. 3 in 15CM739
W/S 1 year probation to run concurrent with 15CF117 with conditions
- $225 restitution to DNA Storage
- Court costs of $243.00 and $200.00 for the DNA Surcharge
- DE is orderd to sign up for probation as soon as he release from the jail
- Bond is modified to a signature and will be vacated as soon as the DE has signed up for probation
- 20 days to appeal
Notice of Motion to Suppress Statements and Notice of Motion to Suppress Evidence. Filed by Atty Andrea. km
Atty Andrea
Pre-trial conference at 01-20-2016 11:30 am

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Nicholas Patrick McDonald appeared.  Court called at 10:47 a.m.  Attorney Andrea has interviewed the DE and he does qualify for a public defender.  DE is currently in jail for a sanction hold until 01/20/16.  Attorney Andrea makes an oral demand for discovery.  Waives speedy trial.  Set out for PTC.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned.  lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Pre-trial conference at 12-29-2015 10:30 am
Pre-trial conference at 12-29-2015 10:30 am

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Megan E. Kelly, DF: Nicholas Patrick McDonald appeared from jail, pro se.  Court called at 1:28 p.m.  DE states he now qualifies for a Public Defender.  DE on a probation hold. Bail is continued.  Continue the PTC.  Court adjourned.  lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 29, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference at 12-28-2015 01:00 pm

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, V & A Storage or Chase Real Estate.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Megan E. Kelly,  DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea for today,  DF:  Nicholas Patrick McDonald appeared from jail. Court confirms address. Defendant is on a PO hold and State would like a $250.00 CB.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Court enters NG.  Reserves speedy trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 28, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
